content.title: Gabatar da HTML
content.value:
HTML ya na nufin HyperText Markup Language. It is the standard language for creating web pages. 
 HTML describes the structure of a webpage using markup. 
 It consists of a series of elements that tell the browser how to display content.

content.title: HTML Documents
content.value:
HTML is essential for web development. It allows you to create structured documents that can be displayed in web browsers. 

With HTML, you can:
- Create headings, paragraphs, links, images, and other content
- Structure your content with lists and tables
- Embed multimedia elements like videos and audio
- Create forms for user input

In this chapter we will show some basic HTML examples.
Don't worry if we use tags you have not learned about yet. They will be explained in later chapters.

You can try these examples in your own HTML files or in an online HTML editor.

content.title: HTML Documents
content.value:
All HTML documents must start with a document type declaration: <!DOCTYPE html>.
The HTML document itself begins with <html> and ends with </html>.
The visible part of the HTML document is between <body> and </body>.

content.title: The <!DOCTYPE> Declaration
content.value:
The <!DOCTYPE> declaration represents the document type, and helps browsers to display web pages correctly.
It must only appear once, at the top of the page (before any HTML tags).
The <!DOCTYPE> declaration is not case sensitive.
The <!DOCTYPE> declaration for HTML5 is:

content.title: HTML5 Doctype
content.value: <!DOCTYPE html>
